templates.title: Incident Report Template
templates.description: Standard incident report format following industry best practices. Includes alert summary, investigation steps, findings, resolution, and ticket notes.
templates.useCase: Documenting security incidents from alert to resolution

templates.title: Ticket Notes Template
templates.description: Ticketing system documentation format. Includes concise format for ticketing systems and detailed format for documentation.
templates.useCase: Creating ticket notes for SOC ticketing systems (Jira, ServiceNow, etc.)

templates.title: Phishing Analysis Template
templates.description: Comprehensive phishing email analysis template. Includes email header analysis, URL/IP reputation checks, IOC extraction, and verdict documentation.
templates.useCase: Analyzing suspicious emails and documenting phishing investigations

cheatSheets.title: Common Ports Cheat Sheet
cheatSheets.description: Quick reference for common network ports and their typical uses in SOC analysis. Includes well-known ports, registered ports, and common malicious ports.
cheatSheets.useCase: Quick reference during network analysis and firewall rule creation

cheatSheets.title: Windows Event IDs Reference
cheatSheets.description: Comprehensive reference for Windows Event IDs used in SOC log analysis. Includes authentication events, process events, network events, and common queries.
cheatSheets.useCase: Quick reference during Windows log analysis and SIEM query development

cheatSheets.title: SIEM Query Notes
cheatSheets.description: Common SIEM queries and search patterns for SOC analysis. Examples in Splunk SPL syntax but concepts apply to other SIEMs.
cheatSheets.useCase: Reference for writing SIEM queries and log analysis

cheatSheets.title: Phishing Indicators Guide
cheatSheets.description: Quick reference guide for identifying phishing emails and campaigns. Includes email header indicators, content analysis, URL analysis, and IOC types.
cheatSheets.useCase: Quick reference during phishing email analysis and investigation

cliCommands.description: Search auth logs for failed login attempts
Show all active network connections with PIDs
Capture network traffic to PCAP file
Find files modified in last 24 hours

cliCommands.command: index=windows EventCode=4625 | stats count by src_ip
cliCommands.description: Count failed login attempts by source IP

cliCommands.command: index=firewall action=blocked | stats count by dest_port
cliCommands.description: Count blocked connections by destination port
examples: index=firewall bytes>1000000 | table src_ip dest_ip bytes

toolbox.description: Essential tools and software for SOC analyst workstation setup

tools.description: Network protocol analyzer for packet inspection

tools.name: Splunk
tools.description: SIEM platform for log analysis and correlation

glossary.definition: Security Information and Event Management - Centralized platform for collecting, correlating, and analyzing security logs and events in real-time.
Indicator of Compromise - Forensic data that identifies potentially malicious activity on a system or network (IPs, domains, file hashes, etc.).
Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response - Platform that automates security operations tasks and incident response workflows.
Endpoint Detection and Response - Security solution that monitors endpoint devices for threats and provides investigation and remediation capabilities.
Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures - The behavior patterns used by threat actors, as categorized in frameworks like MITRE ATT&CK.
Technique where an attacker moves through a network after initial compromise to access additional systems and escalate privileges.
Command and Control - Infrastructure used by attackers to communicate with and control compromised systems.
Regular communication pattern between malware and its C2 server, often at predictable intervals.
Techniques attackers use to maintain access to a system across reboots and credential changes.
Exploiting vulnerabilities or misconfigurations to gain higher-level permissions than initially granted.
Packet Capture - File format for storing network traffic data, commonly analyzed with Wireshark.
Globally-accessible knowledge base of adversary tactics and techniques based on real-world observations.
Unique identifier for Windows event log entries, used to categorize and filter security events.
Search Processing Language - Splunk's query language for searching and analyzing log data.
Alert triggered by legitimate activity incorrectly identified as malicious.
Average time between when an incident occurs and when it is detected by security teams.
Average time from detecting an incident to fully containing and resolving it.
Social engineering attack using fraudulent communications to trick recipients into revealing sensitive information or installing malware.
Vulnerability unknown to the software vendor, often exploited before a patch is available.
Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures - Standardized identifier for known security vulnerabilities.
